channel.title: [Class Suggestion] The Brigand (Unique Neutral Offensive)
channel.description:
**The Brigand** (Unique Neutral Offensive) - AKA Neutral Nuisance
**Goal: Steal from 5 different targets.**
Day Ability 1: **Mimic** (2 uses) Utilise your stolen ability tonight.
* The limited-use ability you take from a targeted player using _Steal_ or _Mug_ will be banked in your Day ability, **Mimic**. * You may choose to activate this ability in order to use one of your stolen abilities, which will be used that night alongside your standard Night abilities. * These abilities do not count as visits. * You set the parameters for these abilities during the day. For example, if you choose to _Mimic_ the **Invoker**'s _Chains of Corax_, you would select which targets would be affected at that time. * If you do not select your parameters by the time the day is over, the _Mimic_ is not used up and nothing happens. * You will be notified if your _Mimic_ failed in any way at the end of the night, with the appropriate response given depending on how it failed.
Night Ability 1: **Steal** Steal an ability from your chosen target.
* This will take a use of a limited-use ability away from your target, and give you the option to _Mimic_ it at a later date. * For example, if you were to _Steal_ from a **Noble** or **Aristocrat**, you would remove one use of their _Maid Spy_ abilities, and add that to your collection of _Mimic_ abilities.
**The full list of abilities that would be stolen from the Thief:**
* **BLUE DRAGON:** 1. **Butler** - _Concentrated Wine_ 2. **Court Wizard** - _Tornado_ 3. **Drunk** - _Happy Hour_ 4. **Hunter** - _Wolf Companion_ (Not Mimic-able) 5. **Knight** - N/A 6. **Mystic** - N/A 7. **Noble** - _Maid Spy_ 8. **Observer** - _Window Peek_ 9. **Paladin** - _Smite_ (Not Mimic-able) 10. **Physician** - _Self-Care_ 11. **Prince** - NA 12. **Princess** - _Will-o-Wisp_ 13. **Sheriff** - _Surveillance_
* **UNSEEN:** 1. **Alcoholic** - _Happy Hour_ 2. **Assassin** - _2-For-1_ (Not Mimic-able) 3. **Aristocrat** - _Maid Spy_ 4. **Duchess** - _Dark Wisp_ (_Mimic_ gives _Will-o-Wisp_) 5. **Enforcer** - _Protection_ (Use on self) 6. **Herbalist** - _Drug_ 7. **Illusionist** - _Mental Blur_ 8. **Marshal** - _Snoop_ 9. **Mastermind** - N/A 10. **Nightwatch** - _Watch Carefully_ 11. **Poacher** - _Spike Traps_ 12. **Sage** - _Wall of Fire_ (_Mimic_ gives _Tornado_) 13. **Servant** - _Concentrated Wine_
* **CULT** 1. **Apostle** - _Mind Warp_ 2. **Cult Leader** - _Eradicate_ (Not Mimic-able) 3. **Invoker** - _Chains of Corax_ 4. **Ritualist** - _Teleportation_ 5. **Seeker** - _Gaze_
* **NEUTRAL** 1. **Alchemist** - _Emerald Potion_ (Not Mimic-able) 2. **Fool** - _Hide_ 3. **Inquisitor** - _Ruthless Efficiency_ (Not Mimic-able) 4. **Mercenary** - N/A 5. **Possessor** - _Possess_ (Not Mimic-able) 6. **Reaper** - N/A 7. **Scorned** - _Frame_ 8. **Sellsword** - N/A 9. **Sorcerer** - _Circle of Death_ (Not Mimic-able)
* If you attempt to _Steal_ from the **Prince**, the **Mystic**, the **Mastermind**, a target who has no limited-use abilities, or a target which has run out of their limited-use ability, your steal will fail, and you will get a message saying that you could not steal from them. * If you _Steal_ a target's use of a limited-use ability that would allow you to kill a target, the ability is taken, but is not added to your collection of _Mimic_ abilities. * If the target that you _Steal_ from would use up their last use of their limited-use ability (e.g. if you attempt to steal a **Drunk** or **Alcoholic**'s final _Happy Hour_ as they choose to use it that same night), they will use that ability and you will receive the aforementioned failed steal message. * If you attempt to _Steal_ from a **Hunter** that uses their _Bear Companion_ that night, you will not die, but you will fail to steal from them. * Your target will be notified that they have been stolen from. * You can only _Steal_ from a target once, unless you have been redirected to target them again. * If your target dies that night, you will still _Steal_ from them, however a message will appear the next day saying the dead have been desecrated, effectively announcing the existence of a **Brigand** to the court. * You cannot target the King.
Night Ability 2 (Optional): **Mug** (2 uses) Threaten the target you steal from into silence for a day.
Identical to _Steal_, but with the following changes:
* The target you _Mug_ will not only have their limited-use ability stolen, but also will not be able to talk, whisper, or vote the next day. * If you attempt to _Mug_ the **Prince**, the **Mystic**, the **Mastermind**, a target who has no limited-use abilities, or a target which has run out of their limited-use ability, your mugging will fail, and your target will still be able to talk, whisper, and vote the next day. * If the target that you _Mug_ would use up their last use of their limited-use ability (e.g. if you attempt to steal a **Drunk** or **Alcoholic**’s final _Happy Hour_ as they choose to use it that same night), you will steal that ability instead, and they will be prevented from using their ability. * If you attempt to _Mug_ a **Hunter** that uses their _Bear Companion_ that night, you will fail to steal from them, and you will be killed as if you were attacking the Hunter.
Lore: TODO
Comments: Once this class has achieved its goal, it loses its Day and Night abilities and becomes an extra vote for whichever faction can lure it over.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Brigand (Unique Neutral Offensive)
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
This class should not be able to determine alignments so easily. It is not relevant to their objective and makes them able to play BD-aligned really easily. Stealing from an unseen/cult/neutral should not give the Brigand an unseen/cult/neutral skill.

Thief is also a way more appropriate name I think, but your call.

I think silent stealing is also a lot better than confirming to your target that there is a brigand, making it impossible to fakeclaim. It should just give a prevented message once the one who technically has no more skill uses (even though it shows there are still skill uses) uses the skill.

This version of Brigand is super confirmable and really BD-sided.

Also he should have some form of survivability like every other neutral has. He needs to survive at least 5 nights after all minimum. Should also be occupy immune in my opinion, he cannot afford to miss nights.
